resources.string:
E-mail: HanGeulider@gmail.com
URL: http://choibean.com/korean
Twitter: @HanGuelider

Landscape (wide) mode

In the wide mode, Hangeulider assumes that you have access to the physical keyboard. Start typing in the text field at the bottom, and you will start to see Korean text appear in the \"Preview\" box to the bottom right. This box will contain the current syllable you are typing, and you can either click on the box or press spacebar to move this character to the \"output\" box towards the top of the screen. This is where you will find Korean text, and you can copy the text in this box when you are done.

Portrait (tall) mode

In the tall mode, we provide you with a virtual keyboard on the screen with Korean ja-eum and mo-eum. Other than that, this is almost identical to the wide mode.

Input Modes

In the wide mode, Hangeulider provides you with two input methods: DuBeolShik and Phonetic. DuBeolShik tries to emulate the standard Korean keyboard layout, with the exception of recognizing the end of each syllable. Currently you have to press space or click on the character preview button to insert that character into the ouput window.

Copying the text

You can either click on the \"Copy\" button or press and hold the output text field to copy the text manually.

Legal

ChoiBean \u00a9 2009
For more information, go to http://choibean.com/korean.
